intro: Antimima meyerae, commonly known as the Meyer's antimony plant, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a small shrub native to South Africa, characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. Antimima meyerae is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its compact size and attractive foliage.
